intro: Neatostema apulum, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and climbing plants. The plant is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, violet to blue flowers that bloom in the morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and twining. Neatostema apulum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
